VEGA model¶

class vega.VEGA(pathway_mask, positive_decoder=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Constructor for class VEGA (VAE Enhanced by Gene Annotations).

Parameters

  • pathway_mask (np.array) – gene module mask

  • positive_decoder (bool) – whether to constrain decoder to positive weights

kwargs:

dev (torch.device): using CPU or CUDA beta (float): weight for KL-divergence dropout (float): dropout rate in model

encode(X)[source]¶

Encode data in latent space.

Parameters

X (torch.tensor) – input data

Returns

data in latent space mu (torch.tensor): mean of variational posterior logvar (torch.tensor): log-variance of variational posterior

Return type

z (torch.tensor)

decode(z)[source]¶

Decode data from latent space.

Parameters

z (torch.tensor) – data embedded in latent space

Returns

decoded data

Return type

X_rec (torch.tensor)

sample_latent(mu, logvar)[source]¶

Sample latent space with reparametrization trick. First convert to std, sample normal(0,1) and get Z.

Parameters

  • mu (torch.tensor) – mean of variational posterior

  • logvar (torch.tensor) – log-variance of variational posterior

Returns

sampled latent space

Return type

eps (torch.tensor)

to_latent(X)[source]¶

Same as encode, but only returns z (no mu and logvar).

Parameters

X (torch.tensor) – input data

Returns

embedded data in latent space

Return type

z (torch.tensor)

bayesian_diff_exp(adata1, adata2, n_samples=2000, use_permutations=True, n_permutations=1000, random_seed=False)[source]¶

Run Bayesian differential expression in latent space. Returns Bayes factor of all factors.

Parameters

  • adata1 (Anndata) – single-cell dataset of group 1

  • adata2 (Anndata) – single-cell dataset of group 2

  • n_samples (int) – number of samples to draw from the latent space

  • use_permutations (bool) – whether to use permutations when computing the double integral

  • n_permutations (int) – number of permutations for MC integral

  • random_seed (int) – Seed for reproducibility

Returns

Dictionary with results (Bayes Factor, Mean Absolute Difference)

Return type

res (dict)

forward(X)[source]¶

Forward pass through full network.

Parameters

X (torch.tensor) – input data

Returns

reconstructed data mu (torch.tensor): mean of variational posterior logvar (torch.tensor): log-variance of variational posterior

Return type

X_rec (torch.Tensor)

vae_loss(y_pred, y_true, mu, logvar)[source]¶

Custom loss for VAE.

Parameters

  • y_pred (torch.tensor) – reconstructed data

  • y_true (torch.tensor) – real data

  • mu (torch.tensor) – mean of variational posterior

  • logvar (torch.tensor) – log-variance of variational posterior

Returns

loss value for current batch

train_model(train_loader, learning_rate, n_epochs, train_patience, test_patience, test_loader=False, save_model=True)[source]¶

Method to train VEGA.

Parameters

  • train_loader (torch.DataLoader) – loader with training data

  • learning_rate (float) – learning rate for SGD

  • n_epochs (int) – number of maximum epochs to train the model

  • train_patience (int) – Early stopping patience for training loss

  • test_patience (int) – Early stopping patience for test loss

  • test_loader (torch.DataLoader) – If available, loader with test data

  • save_model (bool) – If True, save model after training to path attribute of VEGA

Returns

Training history

Return type

epoch_hist (dict)

test_model(loader)[source]¶

Test model on input loader.

Parameters

loader (torch.DataLoader) – loader with test data

Returns

dictionary with test metrics

Return type

test_dict (dict)
